title: Webhook Request Types
description: Telegraph can handle four incoming webhook request types: Chat Messages,  Chat Commands, Callback Queries and Inline Queries:

children.value: Telegraph can handle four incoming webhook request types:
Plain chat messages (messages that are not commands or queries) can be handled by overriding
// in this example, a received message is sent back to the chat
A bot can read non-command/queries messages only if its
is disabled. To change a bot privacy settings see
You can also handle any content of Telegram, like: Contact, Photo, Voice and etc...
// checks that the contact matches the sender ID
Telegraph bots can receive commands from chats where they are registered. A command is a telegram message has a
) char followed by a descriptive word:
what the command will trigger is up to the developer, but a webhook will react to it if it has a public method named as the command:
optionally, the handler method can receive the command parameters:
The full chat message data can be retrieved through the

The default Telegraph's behaviour for unknown commands is to report an exception in application log (this can be disabled in telegraph config) and
answer the user that the command is unknown
A custom handler can be defined by overriding the
Bots messages may ship with keyboard of buttons that trigger actions when pressed:
when pressed, a new call will be forwarded to the webhook with the following payload
action will be handled by a corresponding public method in the custom webhook handler:

html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}
